title: Needing roughly 55 t204s to finish my set
author: shammus

posts.post_title: Needing roughly 55 t204s to finish my set
posts.post_content:
Hoping to start building up my collection of t204s. Can anyone help me with a lower grade example or two?  Beaters and trimmed cards work too!  Thanks much!

Brian

Complete list of t204s I still need is as follows -

Alperman, Ball (NY), Bates, Beebe, Blankenship, Bowerman, Bransfield, Burchell, Byrnes, Carrigan, Clymer, Coakley, Coombs, Crandall, Davis, Donahue, Dorner, Fromme, Ganley, Graham, Hemphill, Hoblitzel, Howard, Kahoe, Kleinon, Lobert, Lush, Manning, McAleer, McConnell, McCormick, McIntyre, Merkle, Mitchell, Milan, Moran, Morgan, Murname, Murphy, Niles, O’Hare, Pelty, Pfeister, Raymond, Reilly, Ruelbach, Sallee, Schlei, Schulte, Shipke, Smith, Spencer, Stahl, Stephens, Sweeney, Tenney

Still looking for all of the t204s listed above.  The ones mentioned in the subject header are amongst the t204s with the highest number of graded speciments in existance so I'm hoping to knock off a couple of them quickly!

PS...the next t204 I get will be my 50th!!  A nice accomplishment so hopefully someone can at least help me snag one of these :)
Monthly bump...Needing 55 cards - still a long way to go on this project....

Hi Brian,

I have a Bell for sale:

[url]http://www.net54baseball.com/showthread.php?t=163528[/url]

Rob

I have a T204 H.Wagner for sale as well...
Buried by now in BST, but still available.
Email or PM me if you'd like:p

Friendly bump....still needing about 55 more t204s for completion....anyone have an extra one from my list above lying around? Thanks in advance!

Brian
